newsitem.title: USA: Air cargo execs to meet in Miami.
newsitem.headline: Air cargo execs to meet in Miami.

text.p: About 150 airport and air cargo executives were set to meet in Miami starting Wednesday to discuss new cargo development issues.
"Air cargo development is increasing rapidly at many airports and has elevated many critical operational, environmental and logistical issues," the sponsors said.

Doug Kuelpman, a vice president at United Parcel Service; John Reagan, a director at Smith Barney Inc and David Hoppin, a principal at cargo consulting firm MergeGlobal, are among the speakers that will address the group on Thursday at Miami's Fountainbleau Hilton Hotel.

The meeting is sponsored by the Airports Council International-North America, the Air Freight Association and American Association of Airport Executives. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
